verses.verse: Now the serpent <WH5175> was more <WH4480> crafty <WH6175> than <WH4480> any <WH3605> beast <WH9130> of the field <WH7704> which <WH834> the Lord <WH3068> God <WH430> had made. <WH6213> And he said <WH559> to the woman, <WH802> "Indeed, <WH637> <WH3588> has God <WH430> said, <WH559> 'You shall not eat <WH398> from any <WH3605> tree <WH6086> of the garden <WH1588>'?"
And the woman <WH802> said <WH559> to the serpent, <WH5175> "From the fruit <WH6529> of the trees <WH6086> of the garden <WH1588> we may eat; <WH398>

but from the fruit <WH6529> of the tree <WH6086> which <WH834> is in the middle <WH8432> of the garden, <WH1588> God <WH430> has said, <WH559> 'You shall not eat <WH398> from it or touch <WH5060> it, lest <WH6435> you die. <WH4191>' "
And the serpent <WH5175> said <WH559> to the woman, <WH802> "You surely <WH4191> shall not die! <WH4191>

"For God <WH430> knows <WH3045> that in the day <WH3117> you eat <WH398> from it your eyes <WH5869> will be opened, <WH6491> and you will be like God, <WH430> knowing <WH3045> good <WH9185> and evil. <WH9563>"

When the woman <WH802> saw <WH7200> that the tree <WH6086> was good <WH2896> for food, <WH3978> and that it was a delight <WH8378> to the eyes, <WH5869> and that the tree <WH6086> was desirable <WH2530> to make [one] wise, <WH7919> she took <WH3947> from its fruit <WH6529> and ate; <WH398> and she gave <WH5414> also <WH1571> to her husband <WH376> with her, and he ate. <WH398>

Then the eyes <WH5869> of both <WH8147> of them were opened, <WH6491> and they knew <WH3045> that they were naked; <WH5903> and they sewed <WH8609> fig <WH8384> leaves <WH5929> together <WH8609> and made <WH6213> themselves <WH1992> loin <WH9118> coverings. <WH9118>

And they heard <WH8085> the sound <WH6963> of the Lord <WH3068> God <WH430> walking <WH1980> in the garden <WH1588> in the cool <WH7307> of the day, <WH3117> and the man <WH120> and his wife <WH802> hid <WH2244> themselves from the presence <WH6440> of the Lord <WH3068> God <WH430> among <WH8432> the trees <WH6086> of the garden. <WH1588>
Then the Lord <WH3068> God <WH430> called <WH7121> to the man, <WH120> and said <WH559> to him, "Where <WH335> are you?"
And he said, <WH559> "I heard <WH8085> the sound <WH6963> of Thee in the garden, <WH1588> and I was afraid <WH3372> because <WH3588> I was naked; <WH5903> so I hid <WH2244> myself."
And He said, <WH559> "Who <WH4310> told <WH5046> you that you were naked <WH5903>? Have you eaten <WH398> from the tree <WH6086> of which <WH834> I commanded <WH6680> you not to eat <WH398>?"
And the man <WH120> said, <WH559> "The woman <WH802> whom <WH834> Thou gavest <WH5414> [to be] with me, she gave <WH5414> me from the tree, <WH6086> and I ate. <WH398>"

Then the Lord <WH3068> God <WH430> said <WH559> to the woman, <WH802> "What <WH4100> is this <WH2088> you have done <WH6213>?" And the woman <WH802> said, <WH559> "The serpent <WH5175> deceived <WH5378> me, and I ate. <WH398>"

And the Lord <WH3068> God <WH430> said <WH559> to the serpent, <WH5175> "Because <WH3588> you have done <WH6213> this, <WH2088> Cursed <WH779> are you more <WH4480> than <WH4480> all <WH3605> cattle, <WH929> And more <WH4480> than <WH4480> every <WH3605> beast <WH9130> of the field; <WH7704> On your belly <WH1512> shall you go, <WH1980> And dust <WH6083> shall you eat <WH398> All <WH3605> the days <WH3117> of your life; <WH9132>

And I will put <WH7896> enmity <WH342> Between <WH996> you and the woman, <WH802> And between <WH996> your seed <WH2233> and her seed; <WH2233> He shall bruise <WH7779> you on the head, <WH7218> And you shall bruise <WH7779> him on the heel. <WH6119>"

To the woman <WH802> He said, <WH559> "I will greatly <WH7235> multiply <WH7235> Your pain <WH6093> in childbirth, <WH2032> In pain <WH6089> you shall bring <WH3205> forth <WH3205> children; <WH1121> Yet your desire <WH8669> shall be for your husband, <WH376> And he shall rule <WH4910> over you."

Then to Adam <WH121> He said, <WH559> "Because <WH3588> you have listened <WH8085> to the voice <WH6963> of your wife, <WH802> and have eaten <WH398> from the tree <WH6086> about which <WH834> I commanded <WH6680> you, saying, <WH559> 'You shall not eat <WH398> from it'; Cursed <WH779> is the ground <WH127> because <WH5668> of you; In toil <WH6093> you shall eat <WH398> of it All <WH3605> the days <WH3117> of your life. <WH9132>
"Both thorns <WH6975> and thistles <WH1863> it shall grow <WH6779> for you; And you shall eat <WH398> the plants <WH6212> of the field; <WH7704>

By the sweat <WH2188> of your face <WH639> You shall eat <WH398> bread, <WH3899> Till <WH5704> you return <WH7725> to the ground, <WH127> Because <WH3588> from it you were taken; <WH3947> For you are dust, <WH6083> And to dust <WH6083> you shall return. <WH7725>"
Now the man <WH120> called <WH7121> his wife's name <WH8034> Eve, <WH2332> because <WH3588> she was the mother <WH517> of all <WH3605> [the] living. <WH2416>
And the Lord <WH3068> God <WH430> made <WH6213> garments <WH3801> of skin <WH5785> for Adam <WH121> and his wife, <WH802> and clothed <WH3847> them.

Then the Lord <WH3068> God <WH430> said, <WH559> "Behold, <WH2005> the man <WH120> has become <WH1961> like one <WH259> of Us, knowing <WH3045> good <WH9185> and evil; <WH9563> and now, <WH6258> lest <WH6435> he stretch <WH7971> out his hand, <WH3027> and take <WH3947> also <WH1571> from the tree <WH6086> of life, <WH9132> and eat, <WH398> and live <WH2421> forever <WH5769>" â€“
therefore the Lord <WH3068> God <WH430> sent <WH7971> him out from the garden <WH1588> of Eden, <WH5731> to cultivate <WH5647> the ground <WH127> from which <WH834> he was taken. <WH3947>

So He drove <WH1644> the man <WH120> out; and at the east <WH6924> of the garden <WH1588> of Eden <WH5731> He stationed <WH7931> the cherubim, <WH3742> and the flaming <WH3858> sword <WH2719> which turned <WH2015> every direction, to guard <WH8104> the way <WH1870> to the tree <WH6086> of life. <WH9132>
